info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 7:49PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Mecklenburg County through 830 PM EDT... At 748 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hitesburg, or 8 miles east of South Boston, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 30 to 40 mph. Rainfall 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locally heavy rainfall may result in minor flooding of poor drainage and low lying areas. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Buffalo Springs around 805 PM EDT. Clarksville around 815 PM EDT. Chase City and Boydton around 830 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Rogers Corner, Buffalo Junction, John H Kerr Dam, Finchley, John H Kerr Reservoir, Skipwith, Wightman and Spanish Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
